TableField.name: ChemicalID
TableField.phrase: Record ID|An automatically assigned number used to track chemicals used by the organization. This number can also used as an internal tracking number for documents; such as: Material Safety Data Sheets, manufacturer labels, waste profile sheets, etc.

TableField.name: OrganizationID
TableField.phrase: Organization|The organization with primary responsibility for chemical oversight for this specific chemical throughout the organization

ForeignField.name: Organization
ForeignField.phrase: Organization|The organization with primary responsibility for chemical oversight for this specific chemical throughout the organization

RemoteField.name: PersonAccountableID
RemoteField.phrase: Person Accountable|The individual assigned primary accountability for chemical oversight for this specific chemical throughout the organization

ForeignField.name: PersonAccountable
ForeignField.phrase: Person Accountable|The individual assigned primary accountability for chemical oversight for this specific chemical throughout the organization

TableField.name: ProductName
TableField.phrase: Product Name|A name assigned to a chemical or chemical compound by its manufacturer for product marketing and trademarking purposes

TableField.name: CommonName
TableField.phrase: Common Name|A common name assigned to a chemical by the organization using it. Common names are more easily recognized than chemical names and can include code names used by an organization to quickly and accurately identify a chemical

TableField.name: ChemicalName
TableField.phrase: Chemical Name|The technical name for a chemical

TableField.name: CASNumber
TableField.phrase: CAS Number|Chemical Abstracts Service Registry Number. CAS Registry Numbers (often referred to as CAS RNs or CAS Numbers) are unique identifiers for chemical substances

RemoteField.name: DateReceived
RemoteField.phrase: Date Received|Date the organization first received and/or used the chemical

TableField.name: ChemicalStatusID
TableField.phrase: Chemical Status|Present use status of this chemical throughout the organization

CodeField.name: ChemicalStatus
CodeField.phrase: Chemical Status|Present use status of this chemical throughout the organization

RemoteField.name: DateDiscontinued
RemoteField.phrase: Date Discontinued|The date on which the organization assigned primary responsibility for enterprise use of this chemical elected to discontinue use of the chemical

TableField.name: ManufacturerID
TableField.phrase: Manufacturer|The name of the manufacturer of the chemical

ForeignField.name: Manufacturer
ForeignField.phrase: Manufacturer|The name of the manufacturer of the chemical

TableField.name: MSDSAvailable
TableField.phrase: Material Safety Data Sheet|Whether a material safety data sheet is available for this chemical and is attached to the record or has a Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) Internet Uniform Resource Locater (URL - Internet address) entered

TableField.name: MSDSURL
TableField.phrase: MSDS Address|Material Safety Data Sheet - Uniform Resource Locater. This is the Internt address where the manufacturer's material safety data sheet or other general information about the chemical is posted and updated

TableField.name: RTECSNumber
TableField.phrase: RTECS Number|Registry of Toxic Effects of Chemical Substances Number

TableField.name: RTECSURL
TableField.phrase: RTECS Address|Registry of Toxic Effects of Chemical Substances Internet address

TableField.name: ICSCNumber
TableField.phrase: ICSC Number|International Chemical Safety Card number

TableField.name: ICSCURL
TableField.phrase: ICSC Address|International Chemical Safety Card address

TableField.name: Processed
TableField.phrase: Processed?|Whether this chemical is used in a system or process

TableField.name: TradeSecret
TableField.phrase: Trade Secret?|Whether this chemical represents an organizational trade secret; such as, a component ingredient in a proprietary product mixture

TableField.name: ExtremelyHazardous
TableField.phrase: Extremely Hazardous?|Whether this chemical is identified as extremely hazardous by a regulatory agency

TableField.name: PotVolatile
TableField.phrase: Potentially Volatile?|Whether this chemical is potentially volatile when mixed with other chemicals or substances

TableField.name: ExceedCoLimits
TableField.phrase: Exceeds Company Limits?|Whether this chemical or composition exceeds established company limits

TableField.name: ProductIngred
TableField.phrase: Product Ingredient?|Whether this chemical is identified as a product ingredient

TableField.name: ContGuarOnFile
TableField.phrase: Continuing Guarantee On File?|Whether this chemical is a product ingredient and the organization has a continuing guarantee on file and/or attached to the record

RemoteField.name: GuarExpirDate
RemoteField.phrase: Guarantee Expiration Date|The date the continuing guarantee expires

TableField.name: ActiveIngredient
TableField.phrase: Active Ingredient|The primary active ingredient which gives the chemical its differentiating properties

TableField.name: HealthID
TableField.phrase: Health Rating|A rating value used to distinguish the chemical's health hazard properties based on severity of risk

CodeField.name: Health
CodeField.phrase: Health Rating|A rating value used to distinguish the chemical's health hazard properties based on severity of risk

TableField.name: FireID
TableField.phrase: Fire Rating|A rating value used to distinguish the chemical's fire hazard properties based on severity of risk

CodeField.name: Fire
CodeField.phrase: Fire Rating|A rating value used to distinguish the chemical's fire hazard properties based on severity of risk

TableField.name: ReactivityID
TableField.phrase: Instability Rating|A rating value used to distinguish the chemical's instability hazard properties based on severity of risk

CodeField.name: Reactivity
CodeField.phrase: Instability Rating|A rating value used to distinguish the chemical's instability hazard properties based on severity of risk

TableField.name: SpecialHazardID
TableField.phrase: Special Hazard Rating|A unique description of the chemicals special hazard properties

CodeField.name: SpecialHazard
CodeField.phrase: Special Hazard Rating|A unique description of the chemicals special hazard properties

TableField.name: SpecialHand
TableField.phrase: Special Handling|A detailed description of any special handling requirements associated with this chemical
TableField.sample: Avoid any contact with milk products when handling this chemical. Avoid any shaking or rapid mixing to avoid explosion.

TableField.name: FlashPoint
TableField.phrase: Flash Point|The lowest temperature at which the material will flash or ignite when exposed to flame

TableField.name: TempUnitsID
TableField.phrase: Temperature Units|The units associated with the chemical's flash point

CodeField.name: TempUnits
CodeField.phrase: Temperature Units|The units associated with the chemical's flash point

TableField.name: pH
TableField.phrase: pH|Measure of the hydrogen ion concentration in a solution

TableField.name: ReportableQuantity
TableField.phrase: Reportable Quantity|The amount of a material which triggers release reporting requirements

TableField.name: WeightVolUnitsID
TableField.phrase: Unit|A combined field used to describe this unit when associating it with other records

ForeignField.name: WeightVolUnitCategoryID
ForeignField.phrase: Unit Category|A broadly defined title or phrase used to group unit types

CodeField.name: WeightVolUnitCategory
CodeField.phrase: Unit Category|A broadly defined title or phrase used to group unit types

ForeignField.name: WeightVolUnits
ForeignField.phrase: Unit|A combined field used to describe this unit when associating it with other records

TableField.name: FederalWasteID
TableField.phrase: Federal Waste ID|Federal waste ID number/s

TableField.name: Solid
TableField.phrase: Solid?|Whether this chemical is present on site as a solid

TableField.name: Liquid
TableField.phrase: Liquid?|Whether this chemical is present on site as a liquid

TableField.name: Gas
TableField.phrase: Gas?|Whether this chemical is present on site as a gas

TableField.name: Responsibilitiesdf
TableField.phrase: Assigned Responsibilities|A detailed description of the responsibilities associated with using the chemical
TableField.sample: The person accountable is the ultimate authority regarding purchase and use of this chemical

TableField.name: Verificationdf
TableField.phrase: Assigned Verification|A detailed description of the verification procedures associated with using the chemical
TableField.sample: Labels from original containers must be checked against the transport label to verify proper handling warnings

TableField.name: Preparationdf
TableField.phrase: Assigned Preparation|A detailed description of the preparation procedures associated with using the chemical
TableField.sample: 1. Secure required protective equipment prior to use of this chemical. 2. Notify the Sanitation Supervisor and one member of the emergency response team prior to using this chemical. 3. Flood the application site with water before application

TableField.name: Applicationdf
TableField.phrase: Assigned Application|A detailed description of the application procedures associated with using the chemical
TableField.sample: 1. Mix the chemical with water at a ratio of 2 parts water to 1 part Chemical. 2. Apply the chemical to the effected site liberally through an industrial sprayer

TableField.name: PostApplicationdf
TableField.phrase: Assigned Post Application|A detailed description of the post application procedures associated with using the chemical
TableField.sample: 1. Decontaminate all protective equipment by rinsing thoroughly with water. 2. return protective equipment to sanitation supply room. 2. Notify the Sanitation Supervisor and the emergency response team member that use is being discontinued. 3. Dilute unused chemical with water 10:1 and flush down sanitation drain

TableField.name: Precautionsdf
TableField.phrase: Assigned Precautions|A detailed description of the precautions to be taken when using the chemical
TableField.sample: 1. Avoid direct skin contact. 2. Avoid contact with eyes. 3. Avoid overspray

TableField.name: FirstAiddf
TableField.phrase: Assigned First Aid|A detailed description of the first aid response to be taken if exposed to the chemical
TableField.sample: 1. Eye contact: proceed to emergency eyewash unit and flush eyes liberally with water for 15 minutes. 2. Skin contact: proceed to emergency shower unit and flush effected area liberally with water for 5 minutes.

SummaryField.name: ExposureRoutes
SummaryField.phrase: Routes of Exposure|The specific routes of exposure associated with the chemical

SummaryField.name: ChemicalCategories
SummaryField.phrase: Chemical Categories|A list of categories used to identify a chemical

CombinedField.name: RecordLabel
CombinedField.phrase: Record Label|The short, concise, label of the record for display purposes

CombinedField.name: Chemical
CombinedField.phrase: Chemical|A combined field used to describe this chemical when associating it with other records

CodeCheckSearchField.name: ExposureRouteID
CodeCheckSearchField.phrase: Routes of Exposure|The specific routes of exposure associated with the chemical

ViewScreen.name: View
ViewScreen.phrase: View|View summary information about a chemical

EditScreen.name: Form
EditScreen.phrase: Form|Edit basic information about a chemical

EditScreen.name: SpecialCharacteristics
EditScreen.phrase: Special|Edit the special characteristics of a chemical

EditScreen.name: PlacardRequirements
EditScreen.phrase: Placard|Edit placarding requirements associated with a chemical

EditScreen.name: Guidance
EditScreen.phrase: Guidance|Associate guidance organizations with the chemical

EditScreen.name: HazardClassifications
EditScreen.phrase: Classifications|Associate hazard classifications with the chemical

EditScreen.name: PackagingEquivalents
EditScreen.phrase: Equivalents|Associate packaging unit equivalents with the chemical

EditScreen.name: ChemicalInventory
EditScreen.phrase: Inventory|Associate inventory levels with the chemical

EditScreen.name: ChemicalComponents
EditScreen.phrase: Components|Associate chemical components with the chemical

EditScreen.name: ChemicalTypes
EditScreen.phrase: Types|Associate chemical categories and types with the chemical

EditScreen.name: HandlingDefaults
EditScreen.phrase: Handling|Generate a default chemical handling procedure which can be adopted by others and/or modified to reflect local requirements

EditScreen.name: HandlingProcedures
EditScreen.phrase: Procedures|Assign a chemical handling procedure to an organization and the chemical

EditScreen.name: ChemicalPhrases
EditScreen.phrase: Phrases|Associate one or more chemical risk or safety phrases with the chemical

EditScreen.name: ThresholdValues
EditScreen.phrase: Thresholds|Associate threshold limits values with the chemical

EditScreen.name: Accountability
EditScreen.phrase: Accountability|Associate participants with ongoing accountabilities with the chemical

EditScreen.name: Involvement
EditScreen.phrase: Involvement|Associate participants involved with the chemical

EditScreen.name: FileRetention
EditScreen.phrase: Files|Associate file retention methods with a physical chemical file

EditScreen.name: BestPractices
EditScreen.phrase: Best Practices|Associate best practices with the chemical

PieChart.name: Pie09
PieChart.title: Chemicals By Health Special Hazard Rating

PieChart.name: Pie19
PieChart.title: Chemicals Which Have A Material Safety Data Sheet Available

DocumentationSection.title: Introduction
DocumentationSection.p: The installation-specific introduction to the scope and purpose of this module should be entered here. You can click the online documentation link beneath the table of contents to see what the active agenda community has said to introduce this module. You are welcome to collect the thoughts of the community, copy them into your local documentation, and extend them to satisfy your local needs.

DocumentationSection.title: Implementation
DocumentationSection.p: Installation-specific implementation rules, policies, practices should be entered here. You can click the online documentation link beneath the table of contents to see what the active agenda community has said about implementating this module. You are welcome to collect the thoughts of the community, copy them into your local documentation, and extend them to satisfy your local needs.

DocumentationSection.p: Installation-specific information regarding the way this module impacts people should be entered here. You can click the online documentation link beneath the table of contents to see what the active agenda community has said about how this module impacts, or is impacted by, people in general. You are welcome to collect the thoughts of the community, copy them into your local documentation, and extend them to satisfy your local needs.
